contentrichtext.text: '''Korczak''' is a Polish [[szlachta|noble]] family name. It may also refer to: * [[Korczak Coat of Arms]] * [[Janusz Korczak]], a pseudonym of Henryk Goldszmit, Polish pediatrician, children's writer and pedagogist, murdered by the Germans at the [[Treblinka]] extermination camp **[[Korczak (film)|''Korczak'' (film)]], a 1990 movie on Janusz Korczak, starring Wojciech Pszoniak **[[Korczak (musical)|''Korczak'' (musical)]], a musical based on the life of Janusz Korczak **[[2163 Korczak]], a main-belt asteroid named in memory of Janusz Korczak * [[Rozka Korczak]], a resistance fighter in [[Vilnuis ghetto]] and later a partisan *[[Korczak, Podlaskie Voivodeship]] (north-east Poland) *[[Korczak Ziółkowski]], American designer and sculptor of [[Crazy Horse Memorial]] *[[Janusz Korczak-Ziolkowski]], Polish-British artist *[[Zbigniew Korczak-Ziolkowski]],Roman Catholic priest,canon of Cracow (died in 1553) == Similar family names == * [[Jaromír Korčák]], Czech geographer, demographer and statistician (1895 – 1989) * [[Josef Korčák]], Czech Communist politician (1921 – 2008) == See also == * [[Korčák]] {{disambig|geo|surname}} [[Category:Polish toponyms]] [[Category:Polish-language surnames]]
